dt: {bc}any of numerous plant-eating orthopterous insects (Acrididae, Tettigoniidae, and some related families) having the hind legs adapted for leaping and sometimes engaging in migratory flights in which whole regions may be stripped of vegetation
{bc}a cocktail made with crème de menthe, crème de cacao, and light cream

shortdef: any of numerous plant-eating orthopterous insects (Acrididae, Tettigoniidae, and some related families) having the hind legs adapted for leaping and sometimes engaging in migratory flights in which whole regions may be stripped of vegetation
a cocktail made with crème de menthe, crème de cacao, and light cream

dt: {bc}a small American sparrow ({it}Ammodramus savannarum{/it}) that is grayish brown above with a pale belly and has a high-pitched buzzing song that resembles the stridulation of grasshoppers

shortdef: a small American sparrow (Ammodramus savannarum) that is grayish brown above with a pale belly and has a high-pitched buzzing song that resembles the stridulation of grasshoppers

dt: {bc}any of various grasshoppers (family Tettigoniidae) distinguished by their very long antennae

shortdef: any of various grasshoppers (family Tettigoniidae) distinguished by their very long antennae

dt: {bc}a widely distributed and sometimes highly destructive small North American grasshopper ({it}Melanoplus femur-rubrum{/it}) with red hind legs

shortdef: a widely distributed and sometimes highly destructive small North American grasshopper (Melanoplus femur-rubrum) with red hind legs —called also red-legged locust

dt: {bc}any of a family (Acrididae) of grasshoppers with short antennae

shortdef: any of a family (Acrididae) of grasshoppers with short antennae

dt.t: I haven't seen you since you were {it}knee-high to a grasshopper{/it}.
